greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the concatenation of the binary numbers that are the divisors of n written in base 2.
comment: a(n) is the concatenation of the numbers of row n of triangle A182620.  The first repeated element is a(15) = 1111011111 = a(479), where a(15) is the concatenation of 1, 11, 101 and 1111 but a(479) is the concatenation of 1 and 111011111. See A182620 and A182622 for more information.
link: Jaroslav Krizek, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
example: The divisors of 10 are 1, 2, 5, 10, which written in base 2 are 1, 10, 101, 1010. The concatenation of 1, 10, 101, 1010 is 1101011010, so a(10) = 1101011010.
program: (Sage) A182621 = lambda n: Integer(''.join(d.str(base=2) for d in divisors(n))) # [D. S. McNeil, Dec 19 2010]
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Nov 22 2010, Nov 23 2010
